storyInfo: Having returned to Kazdel, the Tin Man finds himself mistaken by Nymph and Pohl for being in possession of a revenant fragment. With Ermengarde's help, the gang enters the deepest depths of the Soul Furnace and returns all the fragments, then attempts a different kind of ceremony of appeasement. However, the Tin Man and the other revenants have other plans.

attributes.content: Ermi Ermi, if you read me, please respond.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Ermi...? It's not working?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Young Djall, could you please unbind my hands? I promise I won't run. At least let me have a smoke?
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: No can do! I'm not letting you go until I get you back to the Furnace.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I told you, you've got the wrong guy. I've been meaning to drop by the Furnace, but I really didn't escape from the thing.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: I have a Columbian ID in my shirt pocket. I could show you right now—if you unbind my hands.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: It's a long trip from Columbia to Kazdel, isn't it?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: If you'd told me you were from Rim Billiton, I probably would've believed you.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Ermi, can you hear me? Hey? Hello...?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The box's comm Arts structure has been ruined. You can slap it all you want, but that isn't going to fix it.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: How dare you?! It's your fault my box got crushed in the first place!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: If I fix your little box thing for you, will you free my hands?
attributes.name: Odd Passerby
Nymph
attributes.content: Can you really fix it?

attributes.name: Nymph
attributes.content: Don't you pull any tricks or anything! I-I have my own methods to deal with you!
I got it, little Djall. Relax. I'm not going anywhere.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: Hold on. Are you actually buying this, Nymph? The guy gets possessed by a re—by the ancestors and you're ready to unbind him?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You sure love getting your word in, kiddo, but you don't seem to know a thing about revenants or Djaj. Djaj are the only ones that can't be influenced by revenants.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: I'll free just one of your hands... Hey! How'd you break yourself out of that? You tricked me!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I knew you were up to no good!
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I hope you can appreciate how much it hurts to have my hands bound for so long.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: It hurts, even though you've got iron skin?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's not iron. It's tin. And it doesn't exactly hurt. It's just...
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: Between his metallic fingers is a single cigarette; it seems to have appeared out of nowhere.
The odd man takes it to his mouth, takes a puff, then spins the cigarette around between his fingers before carefully smothering every spark of flame in his palms.
Huff—Ah, that's good.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: You can't buy cigarettes this nice in Kazdel. I have to ration them.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: Hey, you promised you'd fix my box.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I lied.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: A Lich created the Arts in that box, and those prideful bastards never think about repairability when they design things. That's not to say none of them earned their pride, though.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: Come on, you're just going back on your word!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Let me finish. You're looking for someone, aren't you? I can't fix the box, but I can help you find the Lich who made it.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: H-How come you know who I'm looking for?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I don't, but I think I don't need to.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: The strange man leans back as a puff of gray-whitish smoke gradually floats from his mouth.
The smoke disperses into a rippling cloud, like a stone being thrown into a pool of stagnant water. The revenant's trace fluctuations sweep across the area, drowning all of Kazdel in silence.
A brief moment later, the noise has reemerged, and the puff of smoke has completely dispersed.
Who are you exactly?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Just... who are you, mister?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: They call me the Tin Man.
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: Tin Man...?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Look, the one you're looking for is here.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: One can count all the revenants that walk the lands on one hand. Who might you be?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: He says he's the Tin Man.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: He says he's from Columbia.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: ...Kazdel is not ready for your return yet.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Hard to blame you. I never thought I'd ever come back here when I left.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: What did you come back for?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: He says he wants to go to the Furnace.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Nymphy!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Okay okay. I won't interrupt again. Go ahead and ask.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Then allow me to... Never mind. I suppose there's nothing else to ask.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Normally, a guest of your pedigree would be received by my master, but...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Your master? That stubborn old man? Let's not tell him, save my vacation from going completely down the drain.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: If you'd like to visit and take a look beneath the Soul Furnace, I could bring you there, without telling anyone.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: (Shakes head) Not beneath it. I want to go inside it.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Who do you want to visit there?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Who else?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Nymphy, have you gathered all the revenant fragments yet?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: They're all inside my box. Here!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The young Lich nods and nonchalantly throws the slightly misshapen box into the shadows behind her.
Her gaze shifts back and forth between the Djall and the revenant, then finally lands on the Soul Furnace that stands in the distance.
Then let's go.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Nymphy, I'll find another time to give you your reward. And here's the surprise I promised you—Do you want to go into the Soul Furnace for a walk?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Can I really?!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Can I bring friends?! So many kind people have helped us along the way! I could never have collected all the fragments so quickly without them!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Ahem, to tell the truth, I've always wanted to go inside, ever since I was a kid, just to see how it works.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Well... As it stands, we've already broken multiple rules today. so...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Give me just a minute! I'll gather everybody up!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Everybody? Hold on...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Right, for my reward, can I get some scrap Oriron...? Pohl, help me explain it to Ermi, okay?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Uh, alright.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Ah, youth. So motivated. Already sprang away like an arrow from the bow.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I never introduced myself. I'm from down below, the slums, as people call it.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: They call me the Consultant there, and I speak for them. Mr. Tin Man, and the Lich lady. Please, call me Pohl.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Don't call me a lady. Don't you think that's very improper?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Oh, kiddo... In certain ways, you're still far too young.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: One, two, three, four... and me. Five! All of us are here!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Nymphy, the Furnace is a dangerous place. Why did you bring this many people? And that little girl behind you...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: One child ticket, please.
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: This is not a sightseeing spot, and we don't sell tickets! No children, either!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Sorry, Cherie. I tried my best... Maybe next time?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: There's no next time!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: It's okay, Nymph. I was thinking that maybe the big furnace is full of flatbread like the little one we have. Turns out, it's all dark and dirty and lame!
attributes.name: Cherie

attributes.content: What flatbread? We never bake anything with the furnace nodes! Your grandpa is still waiting outside, right? Quick, go find him!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: There are still so many people here. Now what am I going to do with them?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: They all helped me, a lot, and you promised me just now! They won't give you any trouble at all!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Everyone, I need all of you to give me your own words, not just Nymphy's.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: It doesn't matter to me. All I want is to take a look at the work of that legendary designer. I've heard her signature is on the Soul Furnace's blueprints, too. Is that true?
attributes.name: Crownie

attributes.content: Since when has the Soul Furnace had blueprints?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: You can look all you want, but no touching. What about you, Gargoyle? What are you looking at?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: If there's a wide enough pipeline that leads straight out of the city...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Gargoyles tend to be into complicated constructions like this. Don't worry. She's just checking whether the pipelines are sturdy enough.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Right. I'm trying to see if we can crawl through them.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: What about you, Consultant? Trying to live your childhood dream? Like you said before?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: (Shrugs) Is that not good enough of a reason?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I didn't expect to see you here, Qalaiša. What is a Nachzehrer who left her tribe doing here?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Left my tribe? No, we just hold different ideals.
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: As for what I am doing here... Hm, mainly, I couldn't bring myself to refuse such a sincere invitation from this cutie pie.
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: And if I manage to learn a few extraordinary witchcraft rituals while inside the Soul Furnace, that's all the better.
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: None of us here have any reason to lie. What's more, it was a Djall who invited all of us.
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: I've finished a whole cigarette already. Are you done with the roll call yet? I don't suppose anyone's going against their word?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Lich girl, try not to pick up your master's bad habits. Liches used to have a pretty great reputation, but now...
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I'm not very well-versed in history, but I can tell you are making things up.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Okay, now. If everyone's ready, let's get going. Stay close. Don't fall behind.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Hooray! You're the best, Ermi! I knew you would be more amenable than those old, stuck-up fossils!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Turn right at the next corner.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: There are potholes on the ground three steps ahead. Keep left.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: You can open your eyes now. We're here.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: So this is what it looks like inside! What's that faintly glowing thing?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The witchcraft core.
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: This is the deepest part of the Soul Furnace. As far as I know, ever since it was built, only Liches have come here to hold rituals to appease the revenants.
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: And the last ritual caused the big fireworks that led all of us here. Anything else to share?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Mr. Tin Man, should we proceed as we discussed?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Sure. I'll keep an eye out for you.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: The fireworks were only an accident, and the ceremony wasn't completed.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: My master tasked me with finding the revenant fragments scattered all over Kazdel, and I entrusted this mission to Nymph. Nymph then got your help. Which means...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: My master owes all of you a favor. No, he owes all of us a favor.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: As the keeper of the Temple of Knowledge, a favor of his is most valuable indeed. You could accomplish quite a lot with it.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: But, as his student, I've already decided in his place to use this favor to do something exceedingly difficult.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I'm kinda getting the feeling you're about to say something horrible... Is it okay if I leave now?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: No way! I invited you here. If anyone's leaving, I'm leaving first!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Ahem, it's actually nothing to be scared of. She's just being sulky that she got taught a lesson by the stubborn old man, and she's trying to win back some face.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: What face?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: The revenant's... face. I'll finish my master's appeasement ceremony without a flaw. So, are you in?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Yaaahhh!
attributes.name: Crownie

attributes.content: Sorry, I couldn't stand that awkward silence, so I thought I'd make some noise.
attributes.name: Crownie

attributes.content: Uh, like I said, I'm just here to admire that legendary designer's work... Since I've now seen it, I'll leave this revenant business to the rest of you.
attributes.name: Crownie

attributes.content: We kept our eyes closed the whole time, and you're telling me you're already done?!
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: If it was just watching the ceremony, I'd be totally fine, but the Lich here seems to want us to be active participants?
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: If we're dealing with revenants, should we let Amiya know? And the Babel members, too?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: All of us have seen how powerful the revenants can be. Even little fragments were causing chaos all over Kazdel.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Pohl, stop sweating! It's not that bad!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Not that bad? Think about it, Nymph. If it'd taken us just a little longer to get to any one of the fragments, what do you think would have happened?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: There would've been bloodshed if those gangs had drawn their blades, and that berserk colossus wouldn't have stopped its fist...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: And think about the risks when facing the revenants who have been burning in the Furnace for centuries. Is that really something we can take by ourselves?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Like I said, I'll keep an eye out for you.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: A revenant. A powerful revenant who turned his back on his homeland, only to return as if nothing had happened.
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: I have no qualms with this.
attributes.name: Qalaiša

attributes.content: I'm fine with it, too! What's there to be scared of if we have such a bad-ass ancestor looking after us?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You're getting ahead of yourself, Nymph. Even with Mr. Tin Man here, it's not going to be easy to appease the ancestors with just the few of us.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Why do you think it'll be hard? We've met so many people on our way here. Everyone may live pretty hard lives, but we're all living life to the fullest.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Maybe the ceremony failed last time because the ancestors had heard enough nagging. I mean, when all you ever hear is the future and sacrifice, blahblahblah, how is anyone supposed to cheer up?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: If we tell them about how people in Kazdel live these days, that might drive up their enthusiasm!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Besides, the revenants might still remember that legendary designer, they might know her true identity...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: That sounds splendid. Count me in!
attributes.name: Crownie

attributes.content: We've made it this far. We can't go back empty-handed. And if the revenants can show us a secret passageway out of the city...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Then you're in, too! Pohl, what do you say? Still hesitating?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It's a bit of a risk, but I can't think of a reason to not go for it. I'm in.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Okay, then let's throw the ancestors an appeasement ceremony like they've never seen! What do you think, Mr. Tin Man?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I'm intrigued. I said yes to the Lich girl there because she said basically what you just did.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Huh? Really, Ermi?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: We're the ones who will walk the path of Kazdel's future, not them, so...
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Of course, we have the right to do this.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Now cover your ears. I'll begin the incantations.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Let's try again. Relax... Flawed souls, come near, and heed my call.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: In the flames... as your bloodlines melt away... heed my call.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: What's going on? There's no response at all.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Mr. Tin Man, are you still there?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Maybe I've gone too deep... I'm not getting any response. Did I do something wrong?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: No, if I turn back now, I'll be admitting to a failure before it's even over.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: In the shapeless shadows, spots of cold light revolve around my consciousness, leaving layered trails behind them.
Once you try to understand the logic within, you will immediately lose yourself in it. Stop. Think, think...
These... are the revenants' fragments. I remember now. I try bringing them together, but they keep escaping through my fingers, like stardust.
They are talking. There's one... two. A lot of voices slowly drawing near me. The coldness fades away, and the frigid ice burns bright. I can feel it—
Agitation, hatred, chaos... It's more than them not hearing my cries, they... are simply ignoring me. Ultimately, they are annoyed.
They want to... tear me apart.
Step back... Three, two, one. Cut your senses off and step back!
attributes.name: Quiet Voice

attributes.content: Ermi, are you okay?! You were standing there, shaking. That was scary!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I... I'm alright. Where is Mr. Tin Man?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: He's over there by the wall. He hasn't moved for a while now with his head down, and I'm not sure what's going on with him, or if those metallic joints ever ache.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: The ceremony... did it work?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I was returning the fragments to the revenants, but I almost lost myself in their consciousness. It was the Tin Man who saved me.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Not a big deal. I just offered a hand. You could've handled it by yourself, although it would have taken more time.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: He was standing still the whole time, why this sound feels like it's echoing inside my head?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's not a bad thing for kids to have that kind of drive, but you went too deep. Good thing you had an old man like me to watch you from ashore and occasionally drop the odd pearl.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: But the revenants didn't heed my call.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: I half expected as much. Having spent so many years in the Furnace, their brains have been torched. No, they haven't had brains in a long time.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: You, the schemy kid. Yes, you. Give me a hand. Take the notepad from my coat's inside pocket, and a few pens, too.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: You aren't going to suddenly wake up and grab my hand, right? Like that kind of thing in the horror stories.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I'm not that cliche. Once you have the notebook, write down whatever you want to say to the revenants, tear the pages out, and burn them.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: The lighter's in my pants pocket. Or use Arts. Either way.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Will that really reach them?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: They can't make me look bad, right?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Write down whatever you want, but I suggest topics they might be interested in—Hey, what do you folks want to know about?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Things about Kazdel. Write them down, tear the pages out, burn them.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: What are you doing right now...?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I ran into an old friend. We're catching up. Don't worry about me.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I'm finished! Ermi, make me a fireball, will you?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Can't you manage simple Arts like that...? Never mind. Who else has something ready to burn?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: No need. I found the lighter.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Nymph, what did you write?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Not telling. Wishes don't come true if you say them out loud.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You aren't making a wish!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Can you feel it? The Furnace seems to be shaking... I can see it!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The ancestors have manifested!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Me? Actually, he came to me back then too, but I didn't go with him.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I saw the bones on him, clattering away. Were you in there?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.text: Memories don't do anyone any good here other than... adding to the suffering.

attributes.content: But you still recognized me.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.text: Because I loathe you. We loathe you.
Our resentment fanned the flames... It's what he wished.

attributes.content: You lot certainly have a reason to loathe. I find myself with hard feelings every now and then, too.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.text: You should never have returned. Why are you here?

attributes.content: Let's just say I'm here to see old friends. I've spent too much time in Columbia, waking up every morning to see a bunch of newly invented gadgets. But sometimes, I reminisce on old times and old friends.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: That's why I decided to take a vacation and came back here. It's been centuries, and I heard Kazdel got rebuilt again. I was curious what the place would look like.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I heard that they'd be renovating this Furnace soon and there would be a celebration to release all of you. Haha, though I wonder if you'll last that long.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.text: It's more of a... funeral. An endless funeral.

attributes.content: I'm aware.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Revenants. All of you died long ago, but you need a funeral nonetheless.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I understand that. I do...
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: In some parts of Columbia, you tell jokes about the dead at funerals. Everybody laughs and forgets the teary parts. I think that's a pretty good tradition. More places should have funerals like that.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: I just so happened to have met some interesting kids, and they've got some interesting ideas. Why not hear what they have to say? Think of it as a rehearsal for your funeral.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Try not to scare them, though. They... They're all good Kazdelian kids.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: It's only been a second. Why are my legs so stiff? Seems I need to find some time for a spa treatment on my joints.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Hm? Where's my lighter?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: The schemy boy took it.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Can you feel it? The Furnace seems to be shaking... I can see it!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The ancestors have manifested!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Nymph! Watch out! Come over here.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.text: You think you have the right to stand before the revenants and talk about the future of Kazdel?

attributes.content: Not only the future... What I wrote is probably more like legends and folktales?
attributes.name: Crownie

attributes.content: Those mercenaries sounded pretty confident, and I wasn't sure if it was true, so I figured I would ask you if there was ever really a Kazdel city that fell straight to the ground, leaving only a big pit?
attributes.name: Crownie

attributes.text: You would curse Kazdel to be buried in the earth over a mere squabble?

attributes.content: Curse? Perish the thought. If such a place actually exists, I want to see it. I might just find some lost treasures I could use to expand my style.
attributes.name: Crownie

attributes.content: I've already thought up the exhibition's title. 'The Lost Kazdel: Echoes of Eras Past'. Sounds classy, don't you think?
attributes.name: Crownie
Pohl
attributes.content: There's been so many Kazdels over the course of history. Maybe one of them really did come crashing down...

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: Uh, I'm just running my mouth. Don't get mad at me.
What I wrote is my hopes for Kazdel's future, nothing too wild.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Really? Let's see... 'In a New Kazdel, the Sarkaz help one another, and outsiders no longer have to crowd on the city outskirts.'
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: 'People come here for better lives regardless of race, and there is no Royal Court anymore.' Pohl, did you write that?
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: Th-That's mine! Didn't I burn it? How did you find it?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Regardless of race... No Royal Court...
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Can you see what I wrote?
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: Yes. Well... Your vision is pretty bold, Gargoyle. I'm afraid it may never come true.
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.content: A lot of people said the same thing a lot of years ago, to another Gargoyle.
attributes.name: Mudrock

attributes.content: (Whispers) Ermi, Ermi. Which step of the ceremony are we on?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: We're not on any step. Ever since the ancestors showed up, I've completely lost control of this ceremony.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Right now, the feeling I'm getting is that the ancestors are toying with us.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Toying?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: They seem to enjoy hearing a different kind of stories.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Crashing to the earth, flying into the sky, no Royal Court, and an entire city turned to revenants... You people come up with some wild ideas. Do you really think—
attributes.name: Tin Man

attributes.text: Do you really think that, compared to the way it is now, Kazdel would be better like that?
If Kazdel makes its way toward one of them, only to find it's the wrong path, what will you do?

attributes.content: There's no such thing as 'the wrong path'.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Nobody knows what form Kazdel will ultimately take, but all of us want the people here to live better lives.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: If life gets better, how could you call it the wrong path?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Even if the path we end up taking is a treacherous one, it would be better than finding ourselves at a dead end, wouldn't it?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: There is no response from the furnace core. The Tin Man looks down once again, all while his finger continues to rhythmically tap his other arm.
Nymph feels her heart beating faster, as the staff in her hand gets hotter.
Come on, hurry up and say something. Nymph glances at Crownie to plead for help, but she sees only a dark shadow in the distance.

attributes.text: If you think Kazdel would be better that way, then try it for yourselves.
You will prove for yourselves whether the outcome is good or bad, and you will bear any consequences.
Let's see if you truly have the right to find Kazdel... a different path.

attributes.content: A different path... to where?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.text: To the stories you just told.
